revised_title: Melting of Small Bismuth Particles: An Investigation of Time Delay and Temperature Dependence
tldr: This study investigates the melting of small bismuth particles and discovers a time delay in the melting process. The research also reveals that the characteristic time for melting depends on the temperature and morphology of the particles. Platelet-shaped bismuth particles exhibit a significant time delay, allowing some to be superheated by up to 7K above the bulk melting point.
